fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Budget, Trade, Consumers, Enlargement, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Climate Action, Borders and Security, Communication
eu_initiatives: We follow topics in peacebuilding, militarism, human rigths and sustainable economic development.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership:
The Quaker Council for European Affairs belongs to the following formal networks: 
 
European Peacebuiding Liaison Office 
Human Rights and Democracy Network 
Christian Group on Migration 
European Forum on Armed Drones 
Platform for Undocumented Migrants (PICUM)
relevant_communication: We communicate via our blog, website, publications including a bimonthly newsletter, Facebook, and Twitter.
goals__remit: The Quaker Council for European Affairs brings a Quaker vision of just relationships (between peoples, and between people and planet) to the European institutions. We seek to promote values of peace and economic and environmental justice.
